title: Hallmark-The Makeover [2013]
description:
Hallmark-The Makeover (2013)

Air Date: 27 Jan 2013

Summary: Hannah Higgins (Julia Stiles) is a smart, driven education consultant. She's so driven she runs for Congress to advance the cause of education reform. Hannah's not a likable candidate, though; her elitism turns off Boston voters, big-time.
 
Hannah and her business partner, Colleen Pickering (Camryn Manheim) don't give up easily. Next election, they recruit a candidate Ã¢â‚¬â€œ beer vendor Elliot Doolittle (David Walton) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ who definitely is a man-of-the-people. His mother Allie (Frances Fisher) is the definition of "piece of work," as is his sister Allie (Georgia Lyman).
 
Elliot Ã¢â‚¬â€œ whose thick South Boston accent masks considerable intelligence Ã¢â‚¬â€œ is the polar opposite of prim-and-proper Hannah.
 
Hannah takes Elliot on as a "project." Pygmalion-like (modern day), if she can just teach him to speak like gentleman, dress like a gentleman, comport himself like a gentleman .. why he might become a gentleman, a gentleman who can run for Congress Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and win. Elliot and Hannah are about as oil-and-water as two people can be. But as Elliot becomes more "presentable" and Hannah becomes less "proper," could this be a match made in electoral Heaven?
